column5: Got the boat all shinned up and did all my spring maintenance over the last few days Looking good as new   Did a few new mods      And hit the water today Original plan was to hit Lake Erie for perch. But with the launch still a mess and the winds not looking in our favor decided to stick with the lower river. Launched the boat at 1230 was off at 530  First fish in my boat this season was a sucker    My bro was up next with a really nice Brown!!      That's all the fish that we caught But had a blast!! Excellent weather over the past few days here is Southern Ontario!  Tight lines Luke
nice stuff man gorgues day to be outside. Nice boat to. It looks to be in good shape.
Be another 10 or 12 weeks before I see open water.
Boat looks good,the fishing nice as well! Can''t even get the tarp off mine,the snow and ice won't let me lol.
nice going Luke. heading down to the lake today with G;  hopefully we'll  find a brownie or two that wants to play
Good luck out there! The browns are in for sure With yesterday's north wind they will be pushed into shore Good luck!
Very nice, love the rod holder

Nice boat and fish, looks like u had a great day. We went up an ice road yesterday and had to drill through 50 inches of ice, tractor trailers still hauling loads on the ice en route to the mines. Its a vast country we live in.
Long Winter = Massive Itch. Good on ya and love the Brownie.
where did you get the Rod holders from????
The holders (rubber part and the Velcro strap) came from Basspro  The aluminum mounts they are on I made
Nice shooting Luke .....ya got to bend the rod with the whistler anyways and clear the dust from the hull....nice brown for your bro....
Thanks will have to check them out.. need some on my small boat
Nice catch !!!! Always feels great to get the first ride in the boat and first open water fish of the new season!!!!! Cheera
